page.title: 02 Aldridge Parish Church
page.content: The Parish Church at Aldridge probably existed in Norman times. The present structure dates back to the 13th Century. The building was extended in 1841,1853 and 1975. Aldridge and Great Barr became seperate parishes in 1849. Nowadays we have the church of{St. {Mary The Virgin,}two other Anglican churches and a Methodist Church working together. The Rector used to do all the work himself. In those days Aldridge was a small village of 800 people. Today lots of people work with him for Aldridge has become a large town of nearly 18,000 people. On Sundays hundreds of them meet together to worship. During the week boys and girls,teenaged and adults meet to study the bible, help one another and enjoy each others company. Some meet in homes for group fellowship. The young people meet in the Church rooms.
